title: Synthetic Recap
body:
MINNEAPOLIS (AP) — The Minnesota Timberwolves did not just win a basketball game; they bore witness to history. In a commanding 113-96 victory over the Atlanta Hawks, one man transcended the contest, delivering a performance for the ages that left the Target Center crowd in a state of perpetual awe.

That man was Kevin Garnett.

From the opening tip, it was clear this was Garnett’s night. He was an unstoppable force, a whirlwind of intensity on both ends of the floor. When the final horn sounded, the stat sheet told a story of sheer, unadulterated domination: 47 points, 18 rebounds, 6 assists, 4 steals, and 3 blocked shots. He was not merely the best player on the court; he was the entire ecosystem of the game.

The Hawks had no answer. Garnett’s offensive repertoire was on full display—a barrage of effortless jumpers, powerful post moves, and relentless attacks on the glass. Every time Atlanta threatened to close the gap, Garnett responded with a basket, a blocked shot, or a crucial pass, extinguishing their hopes single-handedly. His 47 points were a career-high and a franchise-record eruption that carved up the Atlanta defense.

While Steve Smith paced the Hawks with a valiant 28 points, his effort was a footnote in the face of Garnett’s masterpiece. This was not a game between two teams, but a coronation. Kevin Garnett didn’t just lead his team to a win; he authored a legendary chapter in the Timberwolves’ history book, a night where one superstar’s will became the only story that mattered.
